storyInfo: Late at night, Skadi realizes Specter has disappeared from her treatment ward, and it is none other than Specter's old leader, Gladiia, who has taken her. Before departing, Gladiia tells Skadi that they will be heading for a small town in Iberia.

attributes.content: Silent. Strange. Unfathomable. Outsider.
So they naturally come to say.
Shadowy. Cold-blooded. Leaves for dead. A born monster.
So all will say behind my back.
Yes.
One needs only lose one's home, and one is nothing at all.
Reason says that I, coming here, should have been able to begin a new life.
Except the past cannot be rid. These things follow your shadow and climb your shins, dragging you into the abyss of the swamp.
Not one of us can break free of the past.
If there comes a day, and your home has found you...
2:33 A.M. \ Overcast
Rhodes Island Landship, Hallway
Alright! Once this report's handed in, your field mission will be formally closed out.
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: Mm.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Wait, is it still... blank? Ahem, hm-hm...
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: The only thing on this entire sheet is the word 'complete!'
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: Hmm?
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: The mission definitely is complete.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: I-I mean, that's not wrong...
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: ...but it wouldn't hurt if you wrote a little more, right?!
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: Hm?
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: (What do I do... just how difficult is she?)
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: (I never really talked to her before. I heard we were linking up with her, and the group leader even warned me... but this is still going to be tricky to handle.)
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: (Deep breath)
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: Alright, okay. I understand.
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: If the Doctor has any questions regarding the particulars of your mission, we'll seek confirmation from you again then.
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: ...The Doctor?
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Yes, Dr. Kal'tsit presumed you wouldn't want to hand a report in to her... and she also mentioned Amiya's too soft on you, and it can't go on like this... and so on.
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: So then we filed this mission away on the Doctor's end.
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: That woman. Hmph.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Do you want to report directly, then? Looks like the Doctor's out right now, so you can relax for a few days until the Doctor's back.
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: This report of yours, right now, could seriously use some more fleshing out!
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: Such a pain.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Fine, then. Mission code F1071, confirming submission. Follow-up specifics—
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: Wait.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Huh?
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: Give the files back to me. I've decided, it's okay if I add a few more details.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Oh! Of course it's okay! I'll leave it to you, then.
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: (This might go smoother than I anticipated...)
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: That's all from me then. Do head back and get some proper... um?
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: Your expression just completely changed. Has something happened?
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: In likelihood.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Huh? In here? Aboard the ship? An intruder?! I've heard about your acute senses. Could it be...
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: No, that's not right. The alarms should have sounded if there was danger aboard, right?
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: ...Singing.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Singing? What singing? Er, it's silent all around. I can't hear any...
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: How? Why is there singing here?
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: I suppose there is a sort of droning sound, but that's not a song, is it? There's all kinds of machinery operating aboard Rhodes Island. Is it their vibrations, just maybe? Are you still not fully used to it?
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: No. The scent.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: The scent of the seawater.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: ...Skadi? You're scaring me a little. What are you tal...
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: Huh? Hey! Skadi!
attributes.name: Rhodes Island Operator

attributes.content: Skadi runs too hurriedly, too rapidly. She runs for the stairwell, fearing that those few seconds of apprehension riding the elevator will allow that scent to slip away.

attributes.text: A hunter is walking on seacoast way♪

attributes.content: She can hear the song. Aboard this ship, a vast majority cannot.
This language, this melody, has roused her memories. She is not one for nostalgia, but she knows it all too well.
But... this shouldn't be. This is a song that should not arise here.

attributes.text: With homeland left a mile behind, they must lament and pray♪

attributes.content: The singing shivers all throughout the ship's pipelines.
The scent of seawater, breaking unbreakingly, seeps out from the cabin walls.
Skadi remembers this scent just the same. With the damp closed in on her, her skin continuously contracts, becomes taut. Nervous, yet she is stirred too.
Could she have awoken? She cannot help but hasten her step.
Specter!
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.text: She pulls open the door to the treatment ward.
The bed is empty.
Perhaps she wanted to take a stroll outside after becoming lucid.

attributes.content: Wait... what is this?
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.text: She picks it up, and rubs it in her fingers.

attributes.content: ...It looks like hers.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.text: Specter's gold chain had been carelessly thrown to the ground. Or perhaps, deliberately.
Did she despise this item? Then she surely isn't pleased with her current identity.
The affairs of the Church—at least the Church of the sea—are all nefarious ones.
But... something's not right.
Outsider.
Without knowing why, Skadi has abruptly recalled that word.
She realizes that the scent is not Specter's at all.
Compared to the Specter of past, this scent now is too strong, and too callous. Skadi doubts it was simply a surprise that went all too hard to her head.

attributes.content: You're here. Who are you? Come out.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.text: An Abyssal Hunter. But not Specter. Of all things, there were still other Abyssal Hunters who survived!
But why here?
...Where has Specter gone?

attributes.content: No matter who, or what, you are. Come out.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.text: She needs to give chase. Something's not right. She senses the other one truly is nearby.
Skadi rushes out the door, and a silhouette flashes by the farthest recess of the corridor.
No... it's two. The singing still remains. The other one still incants.
Specter. That Abyssal Hunter has taken Specter.

attributes.content: So laggard.
If you were any slower, we would've been on our way.
Hunter! Who are you?
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: In one leap, Skadi pivots the corner, involuntarily feeling for any weapon on her she can use.
—What are you up to?
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: In that instant, before all else, she meets the other by the eyes.
Wait, you're...
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Someone that she has never expected.
Skadi.
You seem quite well.
Could... you be the Second Company's—Specter's leader...?
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: You're... Gladiia...?!
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: It has been some time, Skadi. You are still able to recollect the Ægir's song, which deeply gratifies me.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.text: Skadi cannot pick out even a single trace of 'gratitude' in her expression. This woman, from the first she knew her, has never once shown any change on her face.

The tall woman carries Specter. The one Abyssal Hunter that Skadi understands to have survived the past several years, Specter, now lies on Gladiia's shoulder, dreaming another uncharacteristically tranquil dream.
The instant Specter's leader let slip a word, the singing vanished.

Skadi is dazed for a spell. From the port window rushes arid winds that only dry land could blow, brushing past Skadi's cheeks, almost dry themselves. She thinks to herself—this hunter is still alive, Gladiia is alive. Skadi has finally found another of her own.
No. It is Gladiia who found them. Yet...

attributes.content: I thought you were dead. You staked your lives to let us pass. I thought you were all dead.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Life is a precious thing. I am very happy to see that you, too, are alive.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Given Specter was still alive, I'd always been wondering whether or not any more of the Second could have made it...
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: How did you find this place? Specter... she's still better off staying in the ward.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: One of the fiercest hunters in all of Skadi's mind chooses, at this juncture, to say nothing.
In Skadi's heart, doubt burgeons.
She's changed a lot. She may not necessarily recognize you now. Her body is still feeble.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Feeble? A hunter could not be feeble.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: How long have you been on dry land?
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Disease of the land, of a special kind, has hollowed her body out. The people aboard this ship can stabilize her condition.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: In all these years, she's never come back to sanity. The current Specter is another person entirely. I don't know what it was that made her like this.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Gladiia does not speak, and the breeze blows through, her hair drifting in its wakes, covering her eye.
Skadi has realized where the problem lies.
Gladiia. Yes, you're Gladiia. There is no mistake. But what do you intend to do?
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Where are you planning to take her?
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: I believed that upon dry land, the hunters were free. Have I misunderstood something?
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: No, Gladiia... she's still asleep. You never asked her... whether or not she wants to go.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: You want to take her away from here.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: You seem to show a great deal of interest in these new colleagues of yours. Do they not treat you too in kind? It would be but a passing motion for you to pinch their spines to dust, yet how is it you do not instill dread in them?
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: For these people of dry land to treat us with enmity is normal, but not for the ones aboard this ship. The ones I have met would not.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: I still cannot fathom why you drop your guard.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: No... I don't want to get them mixed up in this matter. The problem doesn't lie with me, nor them.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: The problem lies in you.
Skadi takes a step toward.
What is your intent in doing this? You had best explain.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Hunter Skadi.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: —On dry land, I will not constrain you with my rank of Consul.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Hm...
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Yet neither do I have any obligation to explain myself to you.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: I simply believe that I should have you know. It was I who took her, a member of my own company. This suffices.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: Why?
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: You need not know the reason yet this evening.
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.content: But Specter!
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: —(Two Iberian words)—
attributes.name: Gladiia

attributes.text: Before the name fully reaches Skadi's ears, Gladiia has already slipped from the ship's window into the moonlight outside, Specter's limp body disappearing with her.
Skadi does not reach out. She does not even move.
She knows well that if Gladiia wants to leave, she has no hope of ever catching her; yet, if Gladiia only wanted to escape, then she would not have left any information behind.
She was seeking help, or she was hoodwinking herself. Skadi half-believes it, half doesn't, yet has no other alternative. At the least, she did not order Skadi to do anything, or not to do anything.
'Sal Viento.'
That is what Gladiia said.
Skadi cannot help but go.

attributes.content: Sal Viento.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: This is far too unmoving a reunion.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: What are you doing here?
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Hey, isn't that Skadi?
attributes.name: Bounty Hunter A

attributes.content: She looks familiar. A little like the picture.
attributes.name: Bounty Hunter B

attributes.content: Ah! Haha, that didn't take any effort at all...
attributes.name: Bounty Hunter A

attributes.content: It's Skadi for sure. We hid in the right spot.
attributes.name: Bounty Hunter A

attributes.content: Hm?
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Hey, see, she responded... and look at her face. That really is Skadi!
attributes.name: Bounty Hunter B

attributes.content: Still remember the 'Captain,' Skadi? We've got his money, and now we're gonna avenge him with your life!
attributes.name: Bounty Hunter A

attributes.content: You crackbrained idiot... you crackbrained idiot! I said this was a rotten idea!
attributes.name: Bounty Hunter B

attributes.content: Didn't we say using his money to run some cons would be enough?! Avenge my ass, bounty my ass! What chance in hell?!
attributes.name: Bounty Hunter B

attributes.content: Remember the rumors! If that's really her, you think there's a single cent in this for us? It'll cost our lives!
attributes.name: Bounty Hunter B

attributes.content: We'd better scram before it's too late! Grab your dumb scrap and run!
attributes.name: Bounty Hunter B

attributes.content: Pah.
attributes.name: Bounty Hunter A

attributes.content: You go crawling back to your shitheap bed cuddling burdenbeast piss and yelling mamá. You lose your nerve the moment a single long-haired girl says something to you. You want ME to go home empty-handed? No goddamn way!
attributes.name: Bounty Hunter A

attributes.content: You're right! Even if she really is Skadi, even if, what the hell can she do? She's all alone right now, isn't she?
attributes.name: Bounty Hunter C

attributes.content: We've got one, two... yeah, a bunch of guys!
attributes.name: Bounty Hunter C

attributes.content: But all those powerhouse bounty hunters are rotting in the ground, aren't they? She was alone then too!
attributes.name: Bounty Hunter B

attributes.content: And think about it, every time you say you have so many guys, does anything good ever come of it?
attributes.name: Bounty Hunter B

attributes.content: And who saw that? If you ask me, those guys? Maybe they just got drunk off their asses one night and all went into the same pretty little Kuranta's room.
attributes.name: Bounty Hunter A

attributes.content: Then she got her crossbows out her pants, went free-for-all, blew their brains to mush.
attributes.name: Bounty Hunter A

attributes.content: That's what rumors are! If all those wandering singers or whoever went around singing and playing without puffing their stories up a little, you think they'd make enough money to eat?
attributes.name: Bounty Hunter A

attributes.content: Splitting fifty mountains with a single sword, yeah, right... and I can punch a hole straight through Londinium with one fist!
attributes.name: Bounty Hunter A

attributes.content: Listen to me, brothers! If you wanna eat, come with me!
attributes.name: Bounty Hunter A

attributes.content: Skadi, Schmadi, we can put her down right here, and nobody can pinch our gold after! Add the bounty the others put on her head, we'll be set for the rest of our lives plus retirement!
attributes.name: Bounty Hunter A

attributes.content: I'll give you a choice. Run now, and you can live. I have no time to waste with you people.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: Charge! Kill her dead!
attributes.name: Bounty Hunter C

attributes.content: (Ægirian) It's the rotted seagrass that clings most to one's leg.
attributes.name: Skadi

attributes.content: I never thought it would be the annoyance of worthless bounty hunters that remained ever unchanging.
attributes.name: Skadi
